answers.answer: well, I guess borderline is better than full blown!!! Glad everything is looking good for the baby!!  Just watch what you eat, and keep us posted on how you are progressing!!
Well, sounds like you know what you have to do. Good luck to you and I hope it doesnt go full blown.

i have to go for the same test the doc said she wanted it done at 28 weeks but recepionest gave me a date for 30 weeks they are doing it becouse my last daughter was born the day after her due date at 10lb how many weeks were you when you had you 1 hr one

I found out like 2 weeks ago that i have gestational diabetes.  it tough getting used to counting carbs and eating every 2-3 hours if you arn't used to it.  Just be glad you dont have to ***** your fingers 4-5 times a day LOL....that really sucks.  Good luck!  Did they tell you how many carb choices you should have a day?
I can't believe you can't say P r i c k.............what is wrong with that in the context i used it?!!!!
why can't you say that word?
cause I guess it could be considered to be "profanity or something"

question: Well I took my 3 hr glucose tolerance test yesterday and the doc finally called me yesterday afternoon.  I'm "borderline" diabetic so I was told to watch my sugars and starches.  It really doesn't surprise me since those are mainly what I eat.  But I'm not terribly concerned, it must not be too bad becuase they don't want to retest me.  So I just gotta watch myself and take it from there.  Fortunately I haven't gained much weight and the baby isn't bigger than average so for now all is good :)
title: Results from My 3 hr OGTT (glucose test)
